qas.question: Where did Queen host a free concert in 1976?
Who organized a free concert by Queen in 1976?
How many people helped Queen set a 1976 attendance record?
Which US venue did Queen sell out in 1977?
Which British venue did Queen sell out in 1977?

context: During 1976, Queen played one of their most famous gigs, a free concert in <a0_0>Hyde Park, London<a0_0/>. A concert organised by the entrepreneur <a1_0>Richard Branson<a1_0/>, it set an attendance record with <a2_0>150,000<a2_0/> people confirmed in the audience. On 1 December 1976, Queen were the intended guests on London's early evening Today programme, but they pulled out at the last-minute, which saw their late replacement on the show, EMI labelmate the Sex Pistols, give their seminal interview. During the A Day at the Races Tour in 1977, Queen performed sold-out shows at <a3_0>Madison Square Garden<a3_0/>, New York, in February, and <a4_0>Earls Court<a4_0/>, London, in June.
